Submodules

pybullet_ros.pybullet_ros_wrapper module

pybullet_ros.pybullet_ros_wrapper.main(args=None)
class pybullet_ros.pybullet_ros_wrapper.pyBulletRosWrapper

Bases: rclpy.node.Node

ROS wrapper class for pybullet simulator

Attributes:

executor (MultiThreadedExecutor): handles the threads running the plugins pb (ModuleType): used to access Pybullet API environment (_type_): used to define simulation environment urdf_flags (int): used to process loaded URDF data robot (int): first robot loaded connected_to_physics_server (bool): identifies if the process is attached to an instance of Pybullet simulation rev_joint_index_name_dic (dict): dictionary mapping joint index to joint name for revolute joints prismatic_joint_index_name_dic (dict): dictionary mapping joint index to joint name for prismatic joints fixed_joint_index_name_dic (dict): dictionary mapping joint index to joint name for fixed joints link_names_to_ids_dic (dict): dictionary mapping link names to link indices plugins (list): list of plugins to load timer (Timer): used as a handle for the timer running the main loop loop_rate (float): determines the rate of the main loop is_gui_needed (bool): determines if the simulation starts with a GUI pause_simulation (bool): identifies if the simulation is paused or not env_plugin (str): name of the environment plugin plugin_import_prefix (str): prefix used to import plugins

get_properties()

construct 3 dictionaries: - joint index to joint name x2 (1 for revolute, 1 for fixed joints) - link name to link index dictionary

Returns:

tuple: tuple containing 3 dictionaries

handle_pause_physics(req)

pause simulation, raise flag to prevent pybullet to execute self.pb.stepSimulation()

Args:

req (Empty): an empty data structure

Returns:

list: empty list

handle_reset_simulation(req)

Callback to handle the service offered by this node to reset the simulation

Args:

req (Empty): an empty data structure

Returns:

list: empty list

handle_unpause_physics(req)

unpause simulation, lower flag to allow pybullet to execute self.pb.stepSimulation()

Args:

req (Empty): an empty data structure

Returns:

list: empty list

init_environment()

set gravity, ground plane and environment

Returns:

int: flags for processing URDF data

init_parameters()

loads ROS 2 parameters

init_plugins(plugins)

finds plugins and sets them up to be executed in multiple threads

Args:

plugins (list): list of strings representing plugins to load

init_pybullet_models()

load URDF models

Returns:

int: unique body id of the first loaded robot

init_services()

loads ROS 2 services

load_urdf(path, pose, yaw, urdf_flags, fixed_base=False)

Loads a single URDF or XACRO robot

Args:

path (str): Path of the URDF or XACRO pose (list): XYZ coordinates of the robot yaw (float): Yaw of the robot urdf_flags (int): flags for processing URDF data fixed_base (bool, optional): force the base of the loaded object to be static. Defaults to False.

Returns:

int: a body unique id, a non-negative integer value

pause_simulation_function()

pauses the PyBullet engine simulation

Returns:

bool: identifies if the simulation is paused or not

start_engine(gui=True)

Starts Pybullet physics engine

Args:

gui (bool, optional): Determines if PyBullet starts with or without a GUI. Defaults to True.

Returns:

int: a physics client id

wrapper_callback()

loop for running physcs simulation
